contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{multiple issues| {{BLP sources|date=March 2010}} {{Cleanup|date=October 2009}} }} {{Infobox astronaut | image = Jean-Pierre Haigneré.jpg | image_size = 111px | name =Jean-Pierre Haigneré | type =[[CNES]] Astronaut | status =Retired | nationality =French | birth_date ={{Birth date and age|df=yes|1948|5|19}} | birth_place =[[Paris]], France | occupation =[[Test pilot|Test Pilot]] | rank =[[Brigadier General]], [[French Air Force]] | selection =[[List of astronauts by selection#1985|1985 CNES Group 2]], [[List of astronauts by selection#1998|1998 ESA Group]] | time =209d 12h 25m | mission =[[Soyuz TM-17]], [[List of Mir Expeditions|Mir Altair]], [[Soyuz TM-16]], [[Soyuz TM-29]] | insignia =[[File:Soyuz-tm17.jpg|30px]] [[File:Soyuz TM-29 logo.png|30px]] |}} '''Jean-Pierre Haigneré''' (born 19 May 1948) is a French [[French Air Force|Air Force]] officer and a former [[CNES]] [[astronaut]]. Haigneré was born in [[Paris]], France and joined the [[French Air Force]], where he trained as a test pilot. He flew on two missions to the [[Mir]] space station in 1993 and 1999. The [[List of Mir Expeditions|Mir Altair]] long-duration mission (186 days) in 1993 also included an [[Extra-vehicular activity|EVA]].<ref>http://www.spacefacts.de/bios/international/english/haignere_jean-pierre.htm Spacefacts biography of Jean-Pierre Haigneré</ref> He is married to former French astronaut [[Claudie Haigneré]]. The [[asteroid]] [[135268 Haigneré]] is named in their combined honour. He has three children, two from a previous marriage and one with Claudie Haigneré. In addition to his duties at the [[European Space Agency]], Haigneré is also involved in a European [[space tourism]] initiative, the ''[[Astronaute Club Européen]]'' (ACE), which he co-founded with Alain Dupas and [[Laurent Gathier]]. ==See also== * [[List of married couples among space travelers]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.cnes.fr/WEB_UK/activites/micropesanteur/spationautes/astronautes/JPHaignere.htm CNES Biography] * [http://ace-asso.eu/ Website of ''Astronaute Club Européen''] {{Authority control|VIAF=22342650}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> | NAME =Haignere, Jean-Pierre | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Astronaut, Air Force officer | DATE OF BIRTH =19 May 1948 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Paris]], France | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Haignere, Jean-Pierre}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:European astronauts]] [[Category:Physician astronauts]] [[Category:French spationauts]] [[Category:Chevaliers of the Ordre national du Mérite]] {{France-mil-bio-stub}} {{Astronaut-stub}}
